results.title: A Very sheepish affair
results.creator_credit: Robert Maxwell, Joseph E. Levine, Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films and Anroste Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 37 of Series “Dodo, the kid from outer space”
Professor Fingers has invented a new sheep shearing machine that gives a really close shave. Unfortunately he tests it in the middle of zero degrees temperatures and the sheep are suffering. Dodo steps in to help the Professor make amends.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Robert Maxwell, Joseph E. Levine, Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films and Anroste Films

results.title: A Very delicate matter (short version)
results.creator_credit: Patrick McCormick, Highgate Pictures and Claude Kerven
results.brief_description: A narrative which highlights the importance of honesty in sexual relationships where venereal disease is concerned. Stresses the responsibility to inform other sexual partners if one discovers one has the disease and indicates the possible consequences of the disease if it is left unchecked.

results.title: A Very British coup
results.creator_credit: Ann Skinner, Sally Hibbin and Mick Jackson
results.brief_description: This is an absorbing political fable for the 90’s. Its a pacy thriller about an attempt to destabilise a fictitious British government. Harry Hopkins is an ex-steel worker from Sheffield who wins a General Election and becomes Prime Minister on a manifesto committed to radical policies. he is a man of the people who has a way with one-liners which fool the press but not the Opposition. Once inside Number 10, Harry enters a world of political intrigue and comes face to face with the media, the Civil Service, the armed forces, his own party and the Opposition. As each problem arises, Harry solves them in his own inimitable style. Cast: Ray McAnally, Alan MacNaughtan, Keith Allen.

results.title: A Versatile Navy
results.brief_description: A catalogue of the ships belonging to the Royal Australian Navy. The film illustrates the advanced modern equipment with which the ships are fitted, and explains their roles in guarding the shoreline of our country.

results.title: A Venezia
results.brief_description: Covers cultural activities during the World Week for Venice, organised by UNESCO. Appearances by Peter Ustinov, Spanish flamenco dancers Jose and Ricardo, Ravi Shankar, Paul McCartney and Wings, Georges Moustaki and many other performers are interspersed with scenes of Venice.

results.title: A Union of opposites
results.creator_credit: David Espar, Tuggelin Yourgrau and WGBH (Boston)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 25 of Series “Discovering psychology”.
In this penultimate episode in the series, Philip Zimbardo looks at the discipline of psychology in terms of reconciling opposites, in the same way as the yin and yang of Eastern philosophy. These include nature and nurture, brain and mind, conditioned responses and behavioural freedom, life span development from infancy to old age, the power and the fallibility of the mind and our role as individuals and as group members. Yet in spite of all the advances in psychological knowledge this century, we can still only suggest the complexity of human nature.

results.title: A Union free seminar
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Mark Zannis, Barrie Howells, Laura Alper and Laszlo Barna
results.brief_description: Techniques for union-proofing the workplace are presented in a concise, straightforward manner by Charles Hughes, management consultant and guru of the North American union-free movement. Excerpted from one of his popular management seminars, this film, and the information Hughes presents in it, will draw the attention of both union organizers and management.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ONF | NFB, Mark Zannis, Barrie Howells, Laura Alper and Laszlo Barna

results.title: A Typical garden spider
results.brief_description: Presents a study of the life cycle of the cross spider showing how the spider builds its web, how it traps food in the web, how the female protects her eggs, and how the young spiders hatch and emerge from cocoons. Includes scenes of a spider trapping a fly in the web, stinging it to paralyse it, and encasing it in a cocoon of silk.
